reviews.review_msg: Giuliano was such a pleasure to have as a professor. He's sweet, kind and accepting of everyone's opinions during discussions. I can't comment on his criteria and grading as it was obvious that Giuliano had to follow a certain curriculum considering he's a new professor and expected to do so. Not his fault. All in all, un prof chill.
ANAS IS SO SWEET!!! Genuinely a very kind, caring and compassionate man. Would 110% take again.

My GOAT ! Grading criteria is very clear + he grades generously. He truly sets you up for success and wants to support your learning. He gives you in class time to complete assignments, so almost no homework ! I love him so much I go to his office hours just to yap. Participation + talking to him in class = easy 10%. BEST PROF EVER

One of the best profs I've ever had at SFU. Not only if he smart and very knowledgeable, but he's also genuinely one of the kindest people you will ever meet. He is friendly, accommodating, and always more than willing to lend a helping hand. This class was brilliant and I will miss it a lot!

Anas is a very kind prof and I really enjoyed his class. He is a generous grader, very approachable and is available for extra help. Sometimes his class felt a little long, but it is an easy class.

Every assignment in FREN300 is a group project. So get ready to talk to your classmates and participate in class discussions. 
Lots of presentations.

Anas was such an amazing professor. He was extremely accommadating, passionate, and very kind, perfect for an oral speaking class that requires everyone to speak in front of each other. He shared a lot about African culture, which I was not personally familiar with, but it was super cool to learn about. Il répète très souvent  « la vie est belle ».
